title: Update `PaymentIntent` apis
body:
Changes:

- Update (currently not auto-generated) payment intent APIs to use consistent API request struct names similar to the autogen'd requests (e.g., `CreatePaymentIntent` instead of `PaymentIntentCreateParams`).

- Fix `transfer_data` type in `CreatePaymentIntent` to be `TransferDataParams`.

---------------------------------------

Fixes #113.

title: Loosen ProductId prefix constraints.
body:
I've tested this locally against the Stripe API. This works for custom
product IDs & works for product IDs generated by Stripe.

Closes #118

title: Update `create` discriminator in code generator.
body:
This broadens the constraints on which structs to generate for creation
related endpoints. Turns out not every endpoint's description contains
the word `[Cc]reate`.

Closes #116

title: Support product param
body:
Closes #110 

Impls the solution discussed in https://github.com/wyyerd/stripe-rs/pull/111

title: warn instead of fail when unable to parse doc site
Adding PaymentMethod::attach to attach a customer for a payment method
body: This resolves #103

title: Fix `RangeQuery` constructors.
body: Fixes https://github.com/wyyerd/stripe-rs/issues/101.

title: Update to use `std::future::Future`
body:
Implements https://github.com/wyyerd/stripe-rs/issues/97.

Gives small improvements towards https://github.com/wyyerd/stripe-rs/issues/96 (primarily by removing the dependency on `reqwest`).

title: Implement feature flags to help reduce binary size
body:
Attempting to improve the situation described in #96.

This change allows parts of the library to be included/excluded via feature flags,
to help reduce code bloat for the common use cases where many modules of the stripe api are unused (like the `Connect` or `Sigma` APIs).

```
# Example: Full Stripe API
stripe-rust = "*"       // ---> defaults to `{ features = ["full", "webhook-events"] }`

# Example: Core-only (enough to create a `Charge` or `Card` or `Customer`)
stripe-rust = { version = "*", default-features = false }

# Example: Support for "Subscriptions" and "Invoices"
stripe-rust = { version = "*", default-features = false, features = ["billing"] }
```

If only the `core` api is enabled (which is sufficient to charge a customer), it reduces the `.rlib` size by 50-60%.

title: Add missing API to async client to match sync version
body:
Async client is missing the ability to use a custom host for API calls (usefull to make unit tests).
Moreover async client is not pub-used like sync version.
This pull request correct this.

title: Fix some errors in generated field types
Fix bad lifetime argument
body:
Generated code won't compile due to a bad lifetime argument.

PS: Sorry for this little PR spam, feel free to dismiss non-pertinent ones.

body: It is basic but covers a good range (maybe everything) for Default derive on parameters.

title: Derive default for eligible parameters
body: Addresses #66

body:
Hey, I added some missing fields to `PaymentIntentCreateParams` as well as a `new` function for
convenience.

body: The customer variant was missing, it's used on the `customer.created` and `customer.updated` events.

Fix broken struct & payment intent list request

title: added Stripe-Version header to Headers
body: This pull request adds the `stripe_version` field to the `Headers` struct, and allows the user to specify which version of the stripe API they'd like to interface with.

title: Fix data type for `default_for_currency`.
body:
Thanks so much for building this.

I found an error in the type definition for the `default_for_currency` field, which appears in 2 different structs.

I realize these files were generated from the spec, but I don't have time at the moment to figure out how that works.

Here's a PR which I hope someone finds useful.

title: Complete invoice events
body:
* Adds missing event types for invoice events (for some reason they seem to be not present in openapi specs?)
* Add a convenience `new()` function to `CreateSubscriptionItems` (for other similar structures the `new()` function was defined, but for `CreateSubscriptionItems` it was missing)

title: Switch id types to use `SmolStr` to avoid unnecessary allocation
Setup `stripe-mock` in the test harness
body: Also adds a few `id` helpers and fixes bugs (updates to the stripe api?) detected by said test harness.

title: Fix bug deserializing subscriptions with metered pricing
body:
Subscription plans can either have [licensed or metered usage](https://stripe.com/docs/api/plans/object#plan_object-usage_type). I ran into a few deserialization errors while using metered usage:



1. The amount field of a Plan can be null if the plan uses tiered metered pricing. (I didn't keep the actual error for this one. It was basically error deserializing null to u64.)

2. The quantity field of a SubscriptionItem does not exist if the subscription uses metered pricing. Error was:
```
Deserialize(Error("missing field `quantity`", line: 120, column: 13))
```

I don't actually use metered pricing so I'm not sure if there might be other issues. These errors just came up on some test data while I was evaluating it.

title: Add receipt_url field to the charge object
body: See https://stripe.com/docs/api/charges/object#charge_object-receipt_url

title: Minor updates to reflect newer API updates
body: This pull request contains a few small changes, that updates a few things to be in accordance with newer versions of the Stripe API.

title: Change FeeDedails, BalanceTransaciton and Payout resources
Corrected Webhook's construct event
body:
Took and example of event creation from official C# library
[EventUtilityTest](https://github.com/stripe/stripe-dotnet/blob/4b316d90ce0e481362a65969709b6a1e52e07faf/src/StripeTests/Services/Events/EventUtilityTest.cs)
And rewrote in rust

First of all, remove use of '[]' because it can panic

Then had to introduce 'current_timestamp' field in Webhook for testing purpose

Changed signature verification - looked it up in java library

Changed some type in InvoiceItem struct

title: removed fields object from PaymentIntent, Refund, Payout
Make 'source' field in PaymentIntent struct optional
body: Found out that source field can be missing in payment intent

title: Merge in v0.9.0 development branch
body:
Changes:

  + Implement async/futures support with `features = ["async"]` (N.B. currently blocking and async cannot both be used in the same project).
  + Apply rustfmt and clippy (w/ config as needed)
  + Update to Edition 2018
  + Flatten Cargo workspace

title: [DEV] Implement async client using a feature flag
body:
To implement async the way that I'd prefer to (https://github.com/wyyerd/stripe-rs/issues/24#issuecomment-451514187), it looks like I'd have to wait for [Generic Associated Types](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/44265). Since I don't expect that to be done any time soon, instead async can be enabled with a feature flag.

See the async example in the `examples` folder.

> __Implements__ https://github.com/wyyerd/stripe-rs/issues/24

title: [DEV] Update to Rust 2018 Edition
body: We already requiring minimum 1.31.0 rustc version, so no reason not to update to 2018.

title: [DEV] Rename `Client`'s `with(params)` to `with_headers(headers)`
body:
First of a few changes for a v0.9.

I'm breaking out each into a separate PR onto a develop branch to make them easier to review for interested citizens.

title: Update Payout/Refund/PaymentIntent params w/ `&str` instead of `String`
Update payment sources to handle Bank Accounts
Add `skip_serializing` on `#[serde(other)]` variants; update some docs
body:
Since Stripe will not accept `"other"` as a value (where enum's are sent in a request) we can catch this error before sending it to stripe.

We also bifurcate `serde` serialization errors to clarify whether the error occurred as part of _sending a request_ or _receiving a response_.

title: Serialize data manually to body using `serde_qs`
body: Fixes https://github.com/wyyerd/stripe-rs/issues/22

title: Fix handling of customer sources list
body: Fixes other issues with https://github.com/wyyerd/stripe-rs/issues/19  (test cases included 🥇)

title: Default source can be any payment method id
body: Fixes https://github.com/wyyerd/stripe-rs/issues/19

title: Migrate to reqwest
body:
Move to reqwest for sync client, which closes #9.

Any feedback is welcome.

Thanks!

title: Fix with account
body:
In order to use Stripe Connect to interact `with` (or as) another account, two headers must be specified, both `Stripe-Account` and `Client-ID`. This fixes the account to use both as required.

Also automated the `stripe/tests/example.rs` to use environment variables and set the necessary ones for travis following documentation available at 
https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/environment-variables/#defining-encrypted-variables-in-travisyml

title: Use short card in source
body: the "card" in source is not a full card object, but rather contains some subset of card fields.

title: Add ach credit transfer to source
Add Clone impls, Add List fetching utility
body:
Adds:
- Clone impls to most types
- Fetching capability so users can paginate easily from List returns
